Description: Fragment of a corner of undyed, plain weave linen cloth with brocaded decoration; Brocading in red, yellow and dark blue wool; Design of three flatened lozenges within a straight-side frame and, above, two smaller simple motifs; Warp: S spun linen, c.9tpc; Weft: S spun inen, c.7tpc, weft brocading in S spun Z ply wool, one brocading thread in every other shed, floating over 5 warp ends and bound by the 6th, some red wool introduced as main weft for narrow bands; Edges: reinforced selvedge (2 reinforced threads of 4 warp threads grouped), two edges cut and ragged, other edge with a warp fringe
Curator's comments: Unreg. 117; Similar to Qasr Ibrim T/21/EA72257 (11th century) and Buhen goat hair mat EA67074 X Group and similar to unreg.118; Found with un-numbered textiles in cupboard P; Probably from a large furnishing cloth; Information from Hero Granger Taylor (30.6.1992)
Condition: Good; Perished in one corner, wool damaged where bleached
